body_content.explanation: to think or talk about something again, in order to make changes to it or to make a decision about it:
examples: The committee is reviewing the current arrangement/situation.
Let's review what has happened so far.
He reviewed his options before making a final decision.

body_content.explanation: If critics review a book, play, film, etc. they write their opinion of it:
examples: I only go to see films that are reviewed favourably.

body_content.explanation: to describe the most important facts in a piece of academic research (= detailed study of a subject) that you have read, and give your opinion of the research:
examples: Weaver reviewed more than 200 peer-reviewed, scientific papers about cloning.

body_content.explanation: When an important person reviews military forces, they formally visit and look at them:
examples: The Queen reviewed the troops on her recent visit.

body_content.explanation: to study again something you have already learned, in preparation for an exam:
examples: We're reviewing (algebra) for the test tomorrow.

body_content.explanation: the act of considering something again in order to make changes to it, give an opinion of it or study it:
examples: an annual review of company performance
a review of the year's top news stories
Salary levels are under review at the moment.
Your licence will come up for review every July.

body_content.explanation: a report in a newspaper, magazine, or programme that gives an opinion about a new book, film, etc.:
examples: Derek writes film/theatre/book reviews for the newspapers.
The play got excellent reviews when it was first seen.

body_content.explanation: a piece of writing that describes the main facts in a piece of academic research (= detailed study of a subject) that you have read, and gives your opinion of it:
examples: An effective literature review summarizes and organizes the conclusions of previous research.
More than 500 scientists contributed to a massive review of published research.

body_content.explanation: a (part of a) newspaper or magazine that has articles on films, books, travel, famous people, etc.:
examples: Could you pass me the review (section of the paper), please?

body_content.explanation: a formal military ceremony in which forces are reviewed by an important person:
examples: Many diplomats attended a naval review to mark the anniversary of the end of the war.

body_content.explanation: information or a practice exercise about a subject to be studied:
examples: Their teacher distributed a review for the exam.
